alfredsnippet.snippet:
Debate about the Earth, Takeuchi, Uyeda & Kanamori, 1970, p.55

"Modern natural science seeks to keep down to the minimum the number of hypotheses on which arguments are to be based. If arguments come to a dead end, it is proper to re-examine the basic hypotheses and, if necessary, to change them drastically, instead of clinging to old assumptions."
alfredsnippet.name: Phys.org Post - Questioning the Original Hypothesis
